intro: Hieracium austrovallesiacum, commonly known as the southern valley hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium austrovallesiacum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
